title: Introduction to Visual Basic - Revised
headline: Learn how to create your own software program using Microsoft Visual Basic in this free online coding course.
description: This course teaches you how to easily create your first program and requires no previous coding experience. Visual Basic is a programming environment from Microsoft that lets you use a graphical user interface (GUI) to choose and modify preselected sections of code written in the BASIC programming language. This course can kickstart your computer programming career as it provides the basic building blocks that form the foundation of software.
courseDescription:
This course covers the installation process of Visual Studio on your computer and explains how different available features like Visual C++ and Visual F# suit your project. You will study errors, the importance of accurate spelling, indentation, and code. You will also learn that you cannot write your code wherever you like since it can result in different outcomes.

We then study the various coding terms used to create different functions for the end user of your applications. We show you how to use project templates, which makes a great starting point for building different types of applications. We investigate the ‘solution explorer’, which is the main navigational device used in Microsoft Visual Basic for finding other files and settings. The course also explains how to use the ‘camel case’ in Java to distinguish when one word ends and another begins.

Visual Basic is a popular programming language characterized by its simple and accessible format. Many beginner programmers often make this Windows application the starting point of their software career. Writing your own code using Visual Basic can be easily learned, and this course provides you with the knowledge you need to develop your programming skills. Sign up to explore the exciting world of computer programming and learn what’s going on inside the box.

Start Course Now
